title: He showed up angry at a Black Lives Matter protest. She showed how to stare him down.
description: A peaceful protest in a small Montana resort town turned ugly Wednesday night when a visibly angry man confronted demonstrators, yelling at them while standing only inches away from their faces.

title: Protests passed a wedding venue. A bride and groom joined them
description: A bride and groom in Philadelphia took a moment out of their wedding day to show solidarity with protesters that were marching against police brutality following the death of George Floyd. HLN's Melissa Knowles reports.

title: A school called off Ivanka Trump's commencement speech. See what she blamed
description: Wichita State University Tech, an affiliate of Wichita State University in Kansas, canceled Ivanka Trump's virtual graduation speech amid backlash over President Donald Trump's response to George Floyd's death and the nationwide protests. CNN's Briana Keilar speaks to a graduate of the school about the decision.

title: Here's where we stand on getting a coronavirus vaccine
description: While coronavirus keeps spreading and killing with impunity, the world waits for a vaccine that could quash the pandemic.

title: Trump's acting DHS chief says he believes George Floyd wouldn't have been spared if he were white
description: Acting Deputy Secretary of the Department of Homeland Security Ken Cuccinelli said Sunday that he does not believe that George Floyd's life would have been spared if he were white.

title: New York City exits lockdown and enters a new crisis
description: After 78 days of coronavirus stay-at-home orders and a death toll larger than all but six countries, New York City begins to reopen Monday.

title: After misjudging national outpouring, it may be too late for Trump to project unity
Here's where we stand on getting a coronavirus vaccine
Coronavirus may be out of headlines, but it has not gone away
description: The coronavirus is out of the headlines while America hits a hinge in history on race -- but it has not gone away.

title: US demands Britain hand over Prince Andrew to be quizzed over Epstein link
description: The US Department of Justice has requested an interview with Prince Andrew as part of its criminal investigation into the alleged sex trafficking ring once operated by Jeffrey Epstein, according to a person familiar with the matter.

title: 'The world is witnessing the birth of a new movement': Democrats unveil sweeping police reform bill
description: Democrats will put forward sweeping policing legislation Monday aimed at cracking down on police brutality and recording patterns of misuse of force across the country -- the first sign that Washington is taking action as a national movement emerges.

title: Colin Powell just called out every Republican in Congress
description: The big news out of Jake Tapper's interview with Colin Powell on Sunday was that the former Republican secretary of state would not be voting for President Donald Trump in 2020.

title: Call to 'defund' the police could play into Trump's hands
description: On Friday, DC Mayor Muriel Bowser had a massive mural reading "Black Lives Matter" in block yellow lettering painted on 16th Street near the White House. The next day, activists painted another message -- in that exact same yellow lettering -- on the same street. It read: "Defund the Police."

title: Britain's biggest companies are cutting tens of thousands of jobs. Millions more are at risk
description: Britain's biggest companies are slashing tens of thousands of jobs in a desperate effort to reduce costs as the coronavirus pandemic shocks the economy and forces businesses into survival mode.

title: A treasure chest hidden in the Rocky Mountains for a decade has finally been found
description: Thousands of brave souls have ventured into the Rocky Mountains for the past decade, searching for a treasure chest filled with gold, rubies, emeralds and diamonds.

title: Country gives 10 free train journeys to all residents as lockdown eases
description: The Belgian government announced Saturday that it would be giving a free ten-journey rail pass to all residents, as part of a package of measures to boost domestic tourism and the economy.

title: I was a black FBI agent. White cops didn't always see me as equal
Seeking the hidden treasure of the Rocky Mountains
description: In 2010 Forrest Fenn hid a real treasure chest somewhere in the Rockies. The only clues to its whereabouts are in a poem.

title: AstraZeneca and Gilead reportedly talked about coronavirus mega merger
description: AstraZeneca has approached rival drugmaker Gilead about a potential merger, according to a Bloomberg report.

title: Lewis Hamilton supports protesters who tore down statue of slave trader
description: Formula One champion Lewis Hamilton has backed anti-racism demonstrators who tore down a statue of 17th-century slave owner Edward Colston in Bristol, southwest England, on Sunday.

title: UK protesters tear down colonial-era statue
CrossFit CEO Greg Glassman apologizes for controversial 'Floyd-19' tweet
description: CrossFit CEO Greg Glassman has apologized for his controversial tweets, in which he criticized the Institute for Health Metrics and Evaluation's statement that racism is a public health issue.

title: Quarantine fatigue: Why some of us have stopped being vigilant and how to overcome it
description: If you've found you're no longer disinfecting your hands as often or becoming more lenient toward unnecessary trips outside, you're not alone.

title: Pressures increasing on Indonesia and Malaysia in the South China Sea
description: Chinese and Malaysian vessels were locked in a high-stakes standoff for more than one month earlier this year, near the island of Borneo in the South China Sea.

title: Person shot after man drove a vehicle into protesters
description: Seattle police say one person has been taken to the hospital and a gun has been recovered from a man who drove into a crowd of protesters Sunday evening.

title: Kourtney Kardashian feels 'responsibility' to talk white privilege with her kids
description: Kourtney Kardashian is urging mothers to use this time of protests as a teachable moment.

title: Airbnb is making a huge comeback
description: Here's another sign that summer travel is rebounding: Airbnb said it's experiencing a surge in bookings as customers emerge from several months of being cooped up in their homes because of Covid-19.

title: After months at sea, the final cruise ship carrying passengers makes it home
description: After a six-month odyssey around the world, during which it was hit by coronavirus and saw the oceans dramatically empty of other vessels, the last cruise liner still carrying passengers has made its final port of call, delivering its eight guests to a world vastly changed from the one they set sail in.

title: BTS and its 'Army' donates more than $2 million to Black Lives Matter
description: The BTS fan-based charity fundraising group "One In An ARMY" has launched a campaign to raise funds in support of the Black Lives Matter movement after the K-pop group donated $1 million.

title: Banksy unveils art in support of Black Lives Matter
description: The anonymous artist shared new artwork and a statement on Instagram in light of recent civil rights protests worldwide.

title: How to lower your coronavirus risk while eating out: Advice from an infectious disease expert
description: As restaurants and bars reopen to the public, it's important to realize that eating out will increase your risk of exposure to the new coronavirus.

title: This baby fox was rescued by firefighters after getting its head stuck in a wheel
description: British firefighters have rescued an inquisitive fox cub that had got its head stuck in a rusty wheel.

title: After misjudging national outpouring, it may be too late for Trump to project unity
description: • CNN Poll: Trump losing ground to Biden

title: American police kill more than other developed countries -- and it's not close
description: Enough.

title: Man rescued after six days trapped in a well
description: A 29-year-old British man has been rescued, after being trapped down a well on the Indonesian island of Bali for six days.

title: China's economy is still struggling to recover from the pandemic
description: China is trying to dig itself out of a steep economic slump. But as the rest of the world still battles with the coronavirus pandemic, the path to recovery is looking slow and painful.

title: How laundry is spilling plastics into the ocean
description: Every time we do the laundry, our clothes shed millions of plastic microfibers. Those that find their way into the ocean may be disrupting life all the way up the food chain.

title: New Zealand's star tourism attraction struggles as visitors stay away post-Covid
description: It's a stunning fall morning in Queenstown, New Zealand. Trees with orange leaves border the calm Lake Wakatipu, and craggy mountains -- the kind made famous by Peter Jackson's "Lord of the Rings" movies -- tower in the distance.

title: Retired Navy captain apologizes after racial slurs streamed on Facebook
description: A retired US Navy captain who used derogatory language and racial slurs during a conversation with his wife that was accidentally live streamed on Facebook says he is "mortified" and working to be a better person.

title: 'Uncertainties' surround next year's Olympics, says Tokyo governor
description: The fate of next year's Olympics depends on Japan's handling of the coronavirus, according to the governor of Tokyo.

title: See the effect that doing your laundry may be having
description: Fibers from synthetic clothing are one of the biggest sources of microplastic pollution. Their effect on the marine environment may be devastating.

title: The Obamas speak out on protest
description: Former President Barack Obama and former first lady Michelle Obama spoke candidly in their virtual commencement speeches about how they feel about the protests following George Floyd's death and what people can do to make change.

title: NYT editorial editor resigns after running Sen. Tom Cotton's op-ed
description: The editor of The New York Times' editorial page, James Bennet, has resigned, publisher A.G. Sulzberger announced. Bennet's resignation comes after the publication of a controversial op-ed from Republican Sen. Tom Cotton earlier in the week drew significant criticism, including from dozens of the newspaper's staffers.

title: Sen. Mitt Romney participates in Floyd protest march
description: Republican Sen. Mitt Romney marched with evangelicals in Washington, telling a Washington Post reporter he was participating in the demonstration "to make sure that people understand that black lives matter." CNN's Pete Muntean has more.

title: White House considering a Trump speech on race and unity
description: After a weekend of massive peaceful protests around the country, White House officials are currently deliberating a plan for President Donald Trump to address the nation this week on issues related to race and national unity, as Housing and Urban Development Secretary Ben Carson hinted in an interview with CNN on Sunday and a senior administration official said was under serious consideration.
